Buena expansi√≥n de Half-Life. Nos cuenta c√≥mo Barney Calhoun, un guardia de seguridad, junto a un grupo de cient√≠ficos intentan escapar de las instalaciones de Black Mesa a causa del incidente ocurrido en ese lugar.
Lamentablemente, este juego no cuenta con voces en espa√±ol (pero hay traducciones disponibles en internet), nuevos enemigos ni nuevas armas. Adem√°s, hay un bug frecuente e inc√≥modo que hace que el personaje empiece a disparar al momento del respawn luego de haber muerto; para evitar que dispare y gaste balas innecesariamente, debes presionar una de las teclas num√©ricas que te permite cambiar de arma.
La duraci√≥n de este juego es muy corta (yo me demor√© casi seis horas prestando atenci√≥n a los detalles y los di√°logos), pero hay que tener en cuenta que el objetivo de este juego es complementar la historia del incidente en Black Mesa, y en ese sentido, el juego cumple.
A m√≠ me gust√≥ mucho la historia, especialmente el final.
Fairly fun game but not even half as fun as the original Half-Life or Half-Life: Opposing Force. There is no multiplayer which is a turnoff and the story is very short. Very little gameplay.

Got into the series back in 2000 owning and regularly playing Half-Life and Opposing Force since then, so was there for the reveal and then eventual release of this expansion and got it after launch in 2001, before showing the friend that showed me the previous titles. As with the first expansion another perspective in which to view experienced events, short but in my opinion better in detail with this being even shorter but I believe even better. Short but sweet is the phrase which sums up Blue Shift, as with the others before it may seem dated to newcomers but less so than previously. A definite recommend together with both the games before it.

Blue Shift keeps up the epic feel from the original, and there's plenty of plot and scripted sequences to keep you grounded in the backstory, however the epic is much, much shorter this time around. So short in fact that even novice FPS players will be able to finish Blue Shift in just a couple of sittings, or one sitting if they're so inclined -- and have a strong bladder.

apparently people say this game is bad but i so far am really enjoying it, it feels way shorter than the other half life games but that's a good thing because this game isn't meant to be as long because your playing as barney, it just gives some different perspective like opposing force did. And personally I like having the shorter game because some parts in opposing force and half life felt like a chore.

My fellow brothers, I, Billy Herrington, stand here today, humbled by the task before us, mindful of the sacrifices born by our nico Nico ancestors. We are in the midst of crisis. Nico Nico Doga is at war against a far reaching storm of disturbance and of leash. Nico Nico's economy is badly weakened, a consequence of carelessness and irresponsibility of the part of management, but also on the collective failure to make hard choices and prepare for a new, mad age. Today, I say to you that the challenge is real, they are serious, and there are many. They will not be easily met or in a short span of time, but know that at Nico Nico, they will be met. In reaffirming the greatness of our site, we understand that greatness is never given, our journey has never been one of shortcuts. It has not been for the path, for the feint hearted, or seek only the fleshly pleasures. Rather, it has been the risk takers, the wasted genie, the creators of mad things. For us, they toiled in sweatshops, endured the lash of the spanking, time and time again. These men struggled and sacrificed so that we might LIVE BETTER. We remain the most powerful sight on the Internet and minds are no less inventive and services were no less needed, that they were last week, or yesterday, or the day before the day after tomorrow. Starting today, we must pull up our pants, dust ourselves off, and begin again the work of remaking Nico Nico Doga. Now, there are some who question the scale of our ambitions, who suggest that out service system cannot tolerate to many movies. There memories are short, for they have forgotten what Nico Nico already has done, what free men can achieve when imagination is joined to common purpose. And so, to all of the people that are watching this video, from the grandest cities to the small villages where Exile was born, know that Nico Nico is a friend of every man who seeks a future of love and peace. Now we will begin to leave authorized common materials to Nico Nico people and forge a hard, earned piece in this mad world. What is required of us now is a new era of responsibility. This is the price and the promise of Nico nicommon's citizenship. Nico Nico Doga in the face of are common dangers in this winter of our hardship, let us remember these timeless words: ASS WE CAN. Let it be said by our children's children that when we were tested by doss attacks, and refused by Youtube, we did not turn back, nor did we falter. And we were carried forth that the great gift of freedom be delivered and is safely to future generations. Thank You. God Bless. And God Bless Nico Nico Doga.

7/10. Blue Shift es una expansi√≥n buena y entretenida pero no te esperes que sea como Opposing Force adem√°s de que la duraci√≥n de esta expansi√≥n es muy corta (1 o 2 horas), opini√≥n m√°s detallada abajo:

Uno de los puntos buenos de la expansi√≥n en mi opini√≥n es:

Crossovers con el Half Life principal y Opposing force:
En esta expansi√≥n nosotros estaremos en el punto de vista de un guardia normal de Black Mesa (Barney Calhoun) y momentos como: 
Insecurity en el elevador justo cuando sucede la cascada de resonancia
Duty Calls cuando vemos a unos miembros de HECU tirando un cuerpo y hacen menci√≥n a Adrian Shephard  Y por ultimo cuando en el final (Deliverance) vemos a Gordon Freeman siendo arrastrado por miembros de HECU as√≠ conect√°ndose con el capitulo "Apprehension" del Half Life principal es muy interesante de ver en esta expansi√≥n como desde el punto de vista de Barney y m√°s si completaste el Half life principal y Opposing Force.

Es entretenido y tiene puzzles divertidos:[/h1]
Esta expansi√≥n te puede llegar a pasar un buen rato ya que se mantiene el Gameplay divertido del Half Life principal y adem√°s de que es f√°cil de entender, esta expansi√≥n tambi√©n es la que incluye m√°s puzzles a comparaci√≥n de hl1 y Opposing Force, los puzzles son simples de entender ya que tampoco son muy complejos.

Lo que considero lo malo: 

Su duraci√≥n:
Es demasiado corto que llega al punto de sentirse algo decepcionante y adem√°s de que sus capitulo de introducci√≥n "Living Quarters Outbound" se llega a sentir algo largo y m√°s que en el siguiente capitulo "[Insecurity]" ya quieres entrar a la acci√≥n a pasar un buen rato pero eso es hasta ya la mitad del capitulo
(HL1 tambi√©n tiene 2 cap√≠tulos de introducci√≥n as√≠ pero al menos se perdona porque dura m√°s tiempo)

Cinem√°ticas a tiempo real que se sienten aburridas:
HL2 tambi√©n tiene cinem√°ticas a tiempo real pero ah√≠ llegan a estar interesantes por como se implementan pero en Blue Shift es diferente ya que momentos con el "Dr. Rosenberg" se llegan a sentir interesantes la 1RA ver pero ya cuando es tu 2DA ver jugando Blue Shift se llega a sentir [/i]tedioso[/i]...

Este es mi primera rese√±a que hago en Steam espero que les sea √∫til
hahaha barney shoots aliens and do puzzles funni

Every story has many sides, ain't different in this one. What happened to Black Mesa facility stayed to Black Mesa facility. Those who survived know the truth. On this expansion you will experience the Black Mesa Security side. 

Though a new remake is coming that contain both expansions and called 'Operation: Black Mesa' you should also play this.

Started the half-life seriese completely blind, I'd never played or seen any of the games before, and when I payed blue shift I loved it just as much as all the others.
I really don't know why it get this much negativity, sure its short but there are plenty of incredible games that are around the same length.

Quick and fun dlc.

Played trough Half life 1, 2 days ago. Then I played Opposing Forces yesterday and today Blue Shift.

All in all I found this dlc way better than Opposing Forces. It felt more compact, without any filler/streching of gameplay, and without bullet spongy enemies and annyoing areas.
